desc: Query haps inside the given time span.

name: splitQueries
desc:
Returns a new pattern, with queries split at cycle boundaries. This makes
some calculations easier to express, as all haps are then constrained to
happen within a cycle.

name: withQuerySpan
desc:
Returns a new pattern, where the given function is applied to the query
timespan before passing it to the original pattern.

name: withQueryTime
desc:
As with withQuerySpan, but the function is applied to both the
begin and end time of the query timespan.

name: withHapSpan
desc:
Similar to withQuerySpan, but the function is applied to the timespans
of all haps returned by pattern queries (both part timespans, and where
present, whole timespans).

name: withHapTime
desc:
As with withHapSpan, but the function is applied to both the
begin and end time of the hap timespans.

name: withHaps
desc: Returns a new pattern with the given function applied to the list of haps returned by every query.

name: withHap
desc: As with withHaps, but applies the function to every hap, rather than every list of haps.

name: setContext
desc: Returns a new pattern with the context field set to every hap set to the given value.

name: withContext
desc: Returns a new pattern with the given function applied to the context field of every hap.

name: stripContext
desc: Returns a new pattern with the context field of every hap set to an empty object.

name: withLoc
desc:
Returns a new pattern with the given location information added to the
context of every hap.

name: filterHaps
desc: Returns a new Pattern, which only returns haps that meet the given test.

params.name: hap_test
params.description: a function which returns false for haps to be removed from the pattern

name: filterValues
desc:
As with filterHaps, but the function is applied to values
inside haps.
examples:
const drums = s("bd sd bd sd")
kick: drums.filterValues((v) => v.s === 'bd').duck(2)
snare: drums.filterValues((v) => v.s === 'sd')
bass: s("saw!4").note("G#1").lpf(80).lpenv(4).orbit(2)

name: removeUndefineds
desc:
Returns a new pattern, with haps containing undefined values removed from
query results.

name: onsetsOnly
desc:
Returns a new pattern, with all haps without onsets filtered out. A hap
with an onset is one with a whole timespan that begins at the same time
as its part timespan.

name: discreteOnly
desc:
Returns a new pattern, with 'continuous' haps (those without 'whole'
timespans) removed from query results.

name: defragmentHaps
desc:
Combines adjacent haps with the same value and whole.  Only
intended for use in tests.

name: firstCycle
desc:
Queries the pattern for the first cycle, returning Haps. Mainly of use when
debugging a pattern.

params.name: with_context
params.description:
set to true, otherwise the context field
will be stripped from the resulting haps.

name: firstCycleValues
desc: Accessor for a list of values returned by querying the first cycle.

name: showFirstCycle
desc: More human-readable version of the firstCycleValues accessor.

name: sortHapsByPart
desc:
Returns a new pattern, which returns haps sorted in temporal order. Mainly
of use when comparing two patterns for equality, in tests.

name: asNumber
desc: Returns a new pattern with all values parsed as numerals.

name: gap
desc: Does absolutely nothing, but with a given metrical 'steps'

name: silence
desc: Does absolutely nothing..

name: pure
desc: A discrete value that repeats once per cycle.

name: timecat
desc: Aliases for stepcat

name: ref
desc: exposes a custom value at query time. basically allows mutating state without evaluation

name: xfade
desc:
Cross-fades between left and right from 0 to 1:

0 = (full left, no right)
.5 = (both equal)
1 = (no left, full right)

name: partials
desc:
Scale the magnitude of the harmonics of one of the core synths ('sine', 'tri', 'saw', ..)
Can also be used to create a new synth via s('user').partials(...)

params.name: magnitudes
params.description: List of [0, 1] magnitudes for partials. 0th entry is the fundamental harmonic (i.e. DC offset is skipped)

name: phases
desc: Rotates the harmonics of one of the core synths ('sine', 'tri', 'saw', 'user', ..) by a list of phases

params.name: phases
params.description: List of [0, 1) phases for partials. 0th entry is the fundamental phase (i.e. DC offset is skipped)

name: FX
desc:
Establishes an FX chain. Can be called by chaining .FX(fx1).FX(fx2)..
calls and/or in a single .FX(fx1, fx2, ..) call. The fx1, .. are patterns which
establish the controls of the given effect. See examples.
examples:
$: s("[sbd <hh [bd | lt | oh]>]*4").dec(.4)
  .FX(
    phaser(0.5).gain(2),
    bpf(800),
    distort(1.3),
    room(0.2),
    delay(0.5).gain(1.25),
    distort(0.3),
  ).fxr(1.7) // sets release time of effects (like delay)

$: s("saw").fm(0.5)
  .delay(0.3) // outer effects are applied *last*
  .FX(coarse(4)) // first coarse
  .FX(lpf(500).lpe(4).lpa(1).lpd(2)) // then lpf
  .FX(distort(1)) // then distort

name: K
desc:
Produces a Kabelsalat modular sound engine.
This can be used as either an effect (by including audioin() at the beginning
of your kabel expression) or as a sound source (via any expression which doesn't
start with audioin()).
Some helpers you have available to you:

Strudel mini notation works fine in K(..) via "" or ``
More complex Strudel expressions (like "0 1 2".fast(4) or irand(24)) can be
written by wrapping them in S(..) inside your Kabel code
We expose Strudel's note frequency under sFreq and Strudel's gate
information under sGate
You can use more complex multi-line expressions (like let x = a; let y = b; x.lpf(y);)
by wrapping them inside a function in K (see example).
examples:
note("A c e".fast(4)).transpose("<0 2 4 6 8>")
  .scale("F:minor").transpose("12")
  .s("saw")
  .K(
    // audioin().mul(sGate.adsr(0.001, 0.3, 0, 0.2)) // as effect
    saw(saw(sFreq / "2!3 16").mul(8).add(sFreq).lag("0!3 0.1")).mul(0.3) // as source
    .mul(sGate.adsr(0, 0.15, 0.5, "0.1!3 1"))
    .lpf(sGate.adsr(0, 0.2, 0.3, 0.2).mul(1).add(0))
    .add(x => x.delay(S("0.3 0.2".fast(2))).mul(0.7))
    .add(x => x.delay("0.03 [0.08 0.01] 0.01 0.013").mul(0.77)).mul(0.7)
    .add(x => x.delay(.13).mul(0.7))
    .out()
  )

name: worklet
desc:
Creates a worklet effect. Typically derived by writing K(...) in the REPL which will parse
Kabelsalat code.

params.name: src
params.description: Source code of the worklet update function

name: saw
desc: A sawtooth signal between 0 and 1.

name: saw2
desc: A sawtooth signal between -1 and 1 (like saw, but bipolar).

name: isaw
desc: A sawtooth signal between 1 and 0 (like saw, but flipped).

name: isaw2
desc: A sawtooth signal between 1 and -1 (like saw2, but flipped).

name: sine2
desc: A sine signal between -1 and 1 (like sine, but bipolar).

name: sine
desc: A sine signal between 0 and 1.

name: cosine
desc: A cosine signal between 0 and 1.

name: cosine2
desc: A cosine signal between -1 and 1 (like cosine, but bipolar).

name: square
desc: A square signal between 0 and 1.

name: square2
desc: A square signal between -1 and 1 (like square, but bipolar).

name: tri
desc: A triangle signal between 0 and 1.

name: tri2
desc: A triangle signal between -1 and 1 (like tri, but bipolar).

name: itri
desc: An inverted triangle signal between 1 and 0 (like tri, but flipped).

name: itri2
desc: An inverted triangle signal between -1 and 1 (like itri, but bipolar).

name: time
desc: A signal representing the cycle time.

name: run
desc: A discrete pattern of numbers from 0 to n-1

name: binary
desc: Creates a binary pattern from a number.

params.name: n
params.description: input number to convert to binary

name: binaryN
desc: Creates a binary pattern from a number, padded to n bits long.

params.name: n
params.description: input number to convert to binary

name: binaryL
desc: Creates a binary list pattern from a number.

params.name: n
params.description:
input number to convert to binary
s("saw").seg(8)
.partials(binaryL(irand(4096).add(1)))

name: binaryNL
desc: Creates a binary list pattern from a number, padded to n bits long.

params.name: n
params.description: input number to convert to binary

name: randL
desc: Creates a list of random numbers of the given length

params.name: n
params.description: Number of random numbers to sample

name: rand
desc: A continuous pattern of random numbers, between 0 and 1.

name: rand2
desc: A continuous pattern of random numbers, between -1 and 1

name: brandBy
desc: A continuous pattern of 0 or 1 (binary random), with a probability for the value being 1

name: brand
desc: A continuous pattern of 0 or 1 (binary random)

name: irand
desc: A continuous pattern of random integers, between 0 and n-1.
examples:
// randomly select scale notes from 0 - 7 (= C to C)
n(irand(8)).struct("x x*2 x x*3").scale("C:minor")

name: perlin
desc: Generates a continuous pattern of perlin noise, in the range 0..1.

name: berlin
desc:
Generates a continuous pattern of [berlin noise](conceived by Jame Coyne and Jade Rowland as a joke but turned out to be surprisingly cool and useful,
like perlin noise but with sawtooth waves), in the range 0..1.

name: reallocateChannelsIfNeeded
desc:
Handles dynamic reallocation of input/output channels buffer
(channel numbers may vary during lifecycle)

name: readInputs
desc: Read next web audio block to input buffers

name: writeOutputs
desc: Write next web audio block from output buffers

name: shiftInputBuffers
desc: Shift left content of input buffers to receive new web audio block

name: shiftOutputBuffers
desc: Shift left content of output buffers to receive new web audio block

name: prepareInputBuffersToSend
desc: Copy contents of input buffers to buffer actually sent to process

name: handleOutputBuffersToRetrieve
desc: Add contents of output buffers just processed to output buffers

name: generateReverb
desc: Generates a reverb impulse response.

params.name: callback
params.description:
Function to call when
the impulse response has been generated. The impulse response
is passed to this function as its parameter. May be called
immediately within the current execution context, or later.

name: generateGraph
desc: Creates a canvas element showing a graph of the given data.

params.name: data
params.description: An array of numbers, or a Float32Array.

params.name: width
params.description: Width in pixels of the canvas.

params.name: height
params.description: Height in pixels of the canvas.

params.name: min
params.description: Minimum value of data for the graph (lower edge).

params.name: max
params.description: Maximum value of data in the graph (upper edge).

name: applyGradualLowpass
desc: Applies a constantly changing lowpass filter to the given sound.

params.name: callback
params.description:
May be called
immediately within the current execution context, or later.

name: samples
desc: Loads a collection of samples to use with s

name: setMaxPolyphony
desc:
Set the max polyphony. If notes are ringing out via release then they will
start to die out in first-in-first-out order once the max polyphony has been hit

name: setGainCurve
desc:
Apply a function to all gains provided in patterns. Can be used to rescale gain to be
quadratic, exponential, etc. rather than linear

params.name: function
params.description: to apply to all gain values

examples:
setGainCurve((x) => x * x) // quadratic gain
s("bd*4").gain(0.5) // equivalent to 0.25 gain normally

name: aliasBank
desc:
Register an alias for a bank of sounds.
Optionally accepts a single argument map of bank aliases.
Optionally accepts a single argument string of a path to a JSON file containing bank aliases.

params.name: alias
params.description: The alias to use for the bank

name: soundAlias
desc: Register an alias for a sound.

params.name: alias
params.description: The alias to use for the sound

name: pickAndRename
desc: Selects entries from source and renames them via map

name: tables
desc: Loads a collection of wavetables to use with s

name: applyHannWindow
desc: Apply Hann window in-place

name: computeMagnitudes
desc: Compute squared magnitudes for peak finding

name: findPeaks
desc: Find peaks in spectrum magnitudes

name: shiftPeaks
desc: Shift peaks and regions of influence by pitchFactor into new specturm

name: chyx
desc: BYTE BEATS

name: crossfade
desc:
Equal Power Crossfade function.
Smoothly transitions between signals A and B, maintaining consistent perceived loudness.

params.name: a
params.description: Signal A (can be a single value or an array value in buffer processing).

params.name: b
params.description: Signal B (can be a single value or an array value in buffer processing).

params.name: m
params.description: Crossfade parameter (0.0 = all A, 1.0 = all B, 0.5 = equal mix).
